reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed this past summer. They are remodeling many of the floors of this hotel. The lobby is 5 stars...unfortunately you're not sleeping in the lobby. We were put in a remodeled room. The view was great...the location was great...the room however felt old and out dated even though it was remodeled. The price was great ($80). A fine hotel to spend your first day or two in Hawaii if you're on a budget. The free breakfast was nothing special so don't get your hopes up.
reviews.title: For the money....good!

reviews.text: Staff was totally great to deal with "very nice" as well as the Concierge lady. Location was good too. Continental Breakfast a bit scarce, but it was better than nothing I guess. I'm a real stickler for clean bathrooms and these bathrooms were VERY Clean no dirt in crevaces or corners; linens on beds crisp and clean, towels so soft and fluffy like. Carpet clean. Furniture needs to be replaced as well as balcony chairs. AC worked good but could be upgraded too. Balcony need to be painted and repaired as there was constant standing water in one area on mine. All in all was a good comfortable stay for the price. If I had to I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in January 2007. We were scared to stay here after reading all the bad reviews, but were surprised when we got there. It was a good hotel (for the price!)
reviews.title: Good Hotel for the Price!

reviews.text: So we had one short night to spend in Hawaii on the way back home. I'd spent three nights at the Sheraton Princess K and it dosen't hold a stick to this place.
reviews.title: Stunning! book the Penthouse

likes.liked: — Stunning modern accomodation - wake up Waikiki this is what its all about
likes.disliked: — I missed breakfast because I had to leave so early - and my stay wasn't longer!

reviews.title: very surprised

reviews.text: I wanted a bath
reviews.title: Don't be nitpicking

reviews.text: I wanted security
reviews.title: Truly awful
Overpriced in paradise
reviews.text: I wanted a hotel I didn't have to think about how to avoid the grime from fellow travellers

reviews.title: Tourists Beware!
reviews.text: I am a resident in Hawaii. So I got the "Kamaina" rate which is a discounted rate with a valid Hawaii Id. I still paid a RIDICULOUS AMOUNT FOR WHAT WE GOT! . There was an ant problem in the bathroom ( a really bad one at that!) My bf and I had to put chewing gum is some of the cracks in order to stop the infestation. Also one of the lights in the room was broken, the bathroom toilet kept running, and to top it off their oh so appealing "FREE CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST" isn't anything more than burnt toast and dry pasteries. Because our room was on the top floor we heard the hustle and bustle of the breakfast room accompanied by the annoying "Anyone for more toast?" At 630 in the morning. I have already made a complaint to the management that has gone unfulfilled and I have told all my friends NOT TO STAY THERE! So this message is specifically out to the tourists. I have stayed at many hotels before and this was the absolute worst!

I have read all the crummy reviews on this place, but when I checked the prices on Waikiki, we decided to stay there (we stayed 3 nights on our way back to Alaska from Kona).......and I was so pleasantly surprised!!! For the price (you can easily spend two to five times the amount they charge for a night), the place was clean, big enough and had the business center with free internet. The staff was wonderful and bent over backwards to help us store our luggage while we went to Pearl Harbor before going to the airport. You can walk all over Waikiki and the convenience of having an ABC store in the lobby is incredible! We opted for the kitchenette and it was nice. I really loved the hotel, will go back next time I go to Waikiki and recommend it to all my friends.
reviews.title: I loved this place and will stay there again!!
Oh, The View
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Hawaii for my husband and myself. We enjoyed our stay at the Gateway. Everything is at your fingertips. The bus is right out front. The ABC store is right there and has almost everything you may need (i.e. bread,milk, wine, sandwiches, hotdogs...) There is TGI Fridays across the street. You can take a bus to shopping malls and restaurants (The Old Spaghetti Factory) or walk to a whole bunch of stores and restaurants (Red Lobster and The Outback). The beach is only a 5 minute walk. The rooms do need some renovations (i.e. new carpeting and the electrical outlet in the bathroom only worked if the cord was in a certain way. The carpets in the hall need replacement.) But, when you step out onto the balconly with that cup of coffee or glass of wine and look at that view and know you are in Hawaii, the carpeting and old furniture seems small. (We were on the 14th floor.) Also, the continental breakfast lady is so worth getting up in the morning and going to the 16th floor for breakfast every morning. She is so nice and friendly. All in all, our trip was great and I would definitly stay there again if we went back.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Value
reviews.text: We stayed at the Gateway Hotel in August. We chose it for the value and we're a little leary about what we were going to get. When we got there, we were pleasantly surprised. Our room was very spacious and clean. The beach was a very short walk. Restaurants and stores were less than a block away. The staff was wonderful. Anything we asked for, they were more than happy to assist us with. Every morning there was a free breakfast on the top floor. The views from this floor were amazing. On our next trip to Hawaii, we will stay at this hotel again.

reviews.title: Unwanted Visitor
reviews.text: We enjoyed Waikiki, but you should be aware that this hotel does not offer much security. We awoke at 9:00 pm to find one of the hotel staff in our room, unannounced. The room was OK for the price, worn but clean. Just don't leave valuables in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2002, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: having seen some of these reviews i had to coment, yes its not a five star hotel but then it dosn"t claim to be and the pool will certainly leave you amazed (if not happy), but hey you pay a fraction what you would pay in the hilton village and you can easily walk there and spend all your day there on the best stretch of beach in waikiki, all in all this hotel is what it says it is, a great base to explore waikiki from, clean friendy and reasonably priced
reviews.title: it is what it is

reviews.text: This place is a dump fromt he recpetion up it is sub-standard. Totally disgusting the wholeplace. Gaps in the doors, broken facilities and not to mention the noise formt he streets below i couldnt even sleep wearing ear plugs it was so loud. Our bedsheets had holes int hem and stains and i would not walk around the carpet barefoot. It was luducrus to call this a three star it was a just truly awful. The pool was little bigger than a bath. The breakfast was served up high on a kind of balcony on plastic tables and cjhairs whilst some oriental lady served you doughnuts from paper bags on paper plates and juice in plastic cups. It made me cringe even thinking about having to return to this place each evening. I would tell anyone do not go to this hotel it is far the worst place i have ever been in!
reviews.title: A Dump!

reviews.text: I have just been reading the reviews for the Gateway. I have come to the conclusion that us Aussies must be far more laid back and carefree than some from other countries.We tended to accept the Gateway for what it is ,not what it COULD be,and put our energies into enjoying the wonderful island of Oahu. I stayed at the Gateway in June '02 as part of a package deal with Qantas Airlines.(4 nights free accomodation with purchase of fares).My sister was also living there with her husband at the time so we were able to extend our stay for a couple of weeks.The hotel is in a fabulous position for shopping trips etc,close to transport and beaches.A 10 minute(if that!!)walk to the international market place.Sure the rooms are old and tired but ours(on the 12th floor) was clean,sheets and bedding clean,bed comfortable and plenty of hot water.What more do you want.!!!! I am hoping to come back in 06-07 and I will DEFINATELY stay again .Mahalo
reviews.title: Wonderful memories

reviews.text: We stayed at the Waikik Gateway hotel after weighing the pros and the cons. Here's a short summary:
reviews.title: It's okay
The most disgusting hotel ever
